mnemonic: POR FAVOR = 'FOR a FAVOR' - please do me a favor!
cultural_note: Use ALWAYS when asking for anything - Portuguese expect politeness
tip: Essential courtesy - use when asking for anything

mnemonic: SE FAZ FAVOR = 'if it DOES favor' - if it pleases you
grammar_notes: Literally 'if it does favor' - very polite
cultural_note: More formal - often used with waiters or in shops
tip: More formal version - common in Portugal especially with service staff

mnemonic: OBRIGADO = 'OBLIGATED' - I'm obligated to thank you!
grammar_notes: Said by MALES - women say 'obrigada'. The speaker's gender matters!
cultural_note: Gender of SPEAKER determines ending - not who you're thanking
tip: Men say obrigado / Women say obrigada - based on YOUR gender!

mnemonic: OBRIGADA ends in A = said by A woman
grammar_notes: Said by FEMALES - the -a ending matches feminine speaker
cultural_note: Your gender determines the word - not the person you're thanking
tip: Women say obrigada / Men say obrigado

mnemonic: DE NADA = 'of NOTHING' - it was nothing!
grammar_notes: Literally 'of nothing' - most common response to thanks
tip: Literally 'of nothing' - most common response to thanks

grammar_notes: Formal/polite apology - use for mistakes or to get attention
cultural_note: Use to apologize OR to politely get someone's attention
tip: Use to apologize or get attention politely

mnemonic: COM LICENÇA = 'with LICENSE' - with your permission!
cultural_note: Use when passing someone squeezing by or entering a room
tip: Use when passing someone or entering a room

mnemonic: SIM sounds like 'SEEM' - yes it seems so!
cultural_note: Often doubled for emphasis: 'sim sim' = 'yes yes'
tip: Simple yes - nasal sound at the end

grammar_notes: Nasal 'ão' sound - air through nose. Also used for negation
cultural_note: The tilde (~) indicates nasal sound - practice making it nasal
tip: Nasal sound - air through nose. Very important Portuguese sound!

mnemonic: TALVEZ = 'TALL VASE' - maybe that tall vase?
grammar_notes: Followed by subjunctive in formal usage - casual: indicative okay
cultural_note: Useful for non-committal responses - very common in conversation

grammar_notes: Also means 'clear' or 'light' (color). Shows strong agreement
cultural_note: Very versatile - can mean 'of course' 'clear' or 'light colored'
tip: Shows strong agreement or confirmation - very useful!

mnemonic: ESTÁ BEM = 'it IS GOOD' - everything is well!
grammar_notes: Very common agreement phrase - used constantly
cultural_note: Multi-purpose: agree to something confirm understanding say goodbye
tip: Very common - used to agree or confirm - like 'okay' or 'alright'
